oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1860 saber
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1860 saber, Union-made but carried by John W. Byerley, 1st Lt., Co. A, 61st Tenn. Mtd. Inf. Regt., CSA. As accounted by his widow's pension application, Byerley became ill while at Vicksburg and was sent home on furlough to Rheatown, Greene Co., Tenn., to convalesce. While returning to his company, he was shot by bushwackers. He died of his wounds on December 28, 1863.
